qas.question: Which arm of NARA handles grants?

answers.text: The National Historical Publications and Records Commission

qas.question: What year was The National Historical Publications and Records Commission established?
About how many grants has the NHPRC awarded?
In what year did public and private archives begin taking grants?
How many grants are awarded by the government annually?
How many colleges and universities award grants to students each year?
In 1964 what was the focus of curriculum in history classes?
What do many nonprofit organizations take part in to support students?

context: <a0_0>The National Historical Publications and Records Commission<a0_0/> (NHPRC)—the agency's <b7_0>grant-making<b7_0/> arm—awards funds to state and local governments, public and private archives, colleges and universities, and other nonprofit organizations to preserve and publish <b6_0>historical records<b6_0/>. Since <a1_0><b3_0>1964<b3_0/><a1_0/>, the NHPRC has awarded some <a2_0><b4_0><b5_0>4,500<b5_0/><b4_0/><a2_0/> grants.
